Package com.cafean.client.ui.swing

Class CheckBoxFocusRenderer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.cafean.client.ui.swing.CheckBoxFocusRenderer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.FocusListener, java.util.EventListener
    public class CheckBoxFocusRenderer
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.FocusListener
    Ensures that the JCheckBox border includes a focus indicator when focused and an empty margin when not. This is necessary for some L&Fs due to the fact that the built-in border that indicates focus wrapped around the label portion of the check-box which is not being used in this case.
    See Also:
    install(javax.swing.JCheckBox)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void focusGained​(java.awt.event.FocusEvent e)  
      void focusLost​(java.awt.event.FocusEvent e)  
      static void install​(javax.swing.JCheckBox checkbox)
      Automatically applies and removes a 'CheckBox.focus' border around the checkbox portion of the given JCheckBox when it receives and looses focus.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • install

        public static void install​(javax.swing.JCheckBox checkbox)
        Automatically applies and removes a 'CheckBox.focus' border around the checkbox portion of the given JCheckBox when it receives and looses focus.

        This behavior will only be activated when using a L&F that provides the CheckBox.focus color (Metal and Windows) via UIManager.getColor(java.lang.Object).

        public void focusGained​(java.awt.event.FocusEvent e)
